inclusion.criterion: carry out the ultrasound or CT-scan for the diagnosis of diastasis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient's medical history relevant to the trial
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ultrasound or CT-scan for the diagnosis of diastasis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The surgical procedure is performed in a single step, under general anesthesia with the assistance of the Intuitiv SI robot.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: An antibioprophylaxis with Amoxicillin/clavulanic acid 1g/200mg IV is administered at induction.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Preoperative marking is performed to identify the palpated medial edges of the rectus abdominis, semilunar lines and costal awnings.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Three trocars are placed: a 12mm trocar, 2 to 3 fingertips above the pubis, median for the optics, a 8mm trocar in the right iliac fossa and a 8mm trocar in the left iliac fossa.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Dissection is started with the finger or foam tip scissors through the opening of the median trocar to ensure that it is in the preaponeurotic plane, in front of the anterior sheath of the large rectus abdominis muscles.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients participating or having participated in the last two months in another clinical study
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has Paget's Disease of Bone and will be treated with Bisphosphonate. The surgical procedure is performed in a single step, under general anesthesia with the assistance of the Intuitiv SI robot.
